page.title: 04Hepscott Village
page.content: Hepscott is a village of houses,farms, a mineral railway and a parish hall. There is a{post office}but it is in someone's garage at one end of the village.The Victorian post box is at the other end.There are no{shops}or {inns}becauce a farmer owner who was a Duchess of Carlisle made this rule.A new housing astate,Field House Close is named after Field House Farm.There are no ponds or suitable places to fish,but the Hepscott burn runs through the village.The bridge over this,near the farm may never be repaired,as no seems to own it.A walk through Hepscott takes about an hour. Land is regularly sold for houses.At one time croft's park was part of the Croft and its garden.
